revised_title: Antarctic Marine Mammals: Seals and Whales of the Southern Ocean
tldr: This article discusses the unique species of seals and whales found in the Antarctic and their role in the Southern Ocean's ecosystem. It highlights the larger body sizes of these species, their adaptation to the Antarctic environment, and the impact of whaling on their populations. The article also addresses the importance of conservation and management to restore the original balance of the ecosystem.
